item.title: Blog Setup
item.description: This is a How-to Article for quickly setting up a blog with Quartz and Obsidian.md. Prerequisites Obsidian installed on your local machine (because Quartz is Markdown-based) Github-Account Basic Knowledge of Github and Git.

item.title: Creating a Project
item.description: To create a Monogame project, you have to navigate into your project folder and fill this template with the correct arguments:

item.title: First Blog entry
item.description: Hey there, For our games lecture at DHBW Karlsruhe we have to run a blog, where we tell you about our findings and development of our game “A Journey of Music”.

item.title: First Steps with MonoGame
item.description: We can announce, that we have made first steps in MonoGame (literally!). We can move the character up and down, left and right, by inputting the keyboard.

item.title: Getting MGCB Editor to work on Linux
item.description: To add media to your project MonoGame uses a proprietary file format to map the media to game entities. To edit the specified file, you need an editor, which runs in your project folder (!

item.title: Plans for next week
item.description: As it is only the start of the semester, we have more time than in three months from now so we can put a lot of time into this.

item.title: Setting up Monogame for development
item.description: Before any Game could be implemented, there is a setup for the development environment todo. Of course you could just follow the Setup-Guide at MonoGame’s website.

item.title: The software you need!
item.description: As we went with Monogame as our Game Engine, we need a lot of external tools around it, as Monogame itself only comes with the MGCB-Editor as an image preprocessor.
